metadata.title: CVE-2019-16249 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenCV 4.1.1 has an out-of-bounds read in hal_baseline::v_load incore/hal/intrin_sse.hpp when called from computeSSDMeanNorm inmodules/video/src/dis_flow.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16249` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-contrib3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-core3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-features2d3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-flann3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-highgui3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-imgcodecs3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-imgproc3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-ml3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-objdetect3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-photo3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-shape3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-stitching3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-superres3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-video3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-videoio3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-videostab3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv-viz3.2 - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv3.2-java - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
libopencv3.2-jni - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
opencv-data - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
python-opencv - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
python3-opencv - 3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: opencv package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.0+dfsg-4ubuntu0.1+esm4').
